com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats

Class HistogramAccumulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats.BaseAccumulator
        • com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats.HistogramAccumulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IAccumulator, IHistogramStats, IStats

    public final class HistogramAccumulator
extends BaseAccumulator
implements IHistogramStats, IAccumulator
    Accumulator based histogram implementation.

    This class decorates an instance of Histogram with IAccumulator features so that it can be plugged in via the Catalys configuration subsystem.

    A set of default interval bounds is provided so that no configuration is necessary to use this class. The default intervals assume that the unit of measurement is nanoseconds and that the unit of interest is microseconds. They are organised roughly on a logarithmic scale so that there are intervals for:

    • digit microseconds (0-1, 1-2, ..., 9-10)
    • tens of microseconds (10-20, 20-30, ... 90-100)
    • hundreds of microseconds (100-200, 200-300, ... 900-1000)
    • milliseconds (1-2, 2-3, ..., 9-10)
    • milliseconds (10-20, 20-30, ..., 90-100)
    • milliseconds (100-200, 200-300, ..., 900-1000)

    If the default intervals are inadequate then they may be specified via a suitable constructor or as part of the properties for this element via the Catalys configuration subsystem.

    The property used to specify intervals is INTERVAL_UPPER_BOUNDS_KEY (intervalUpperBounds). This property must be a comma separated list of positive, monotonically increasing, non floating point, numbers. Each number is treated as the upper bound of an interval.

    This implementation supports via properties:

    • Ignoring a configured number of observations at startup - see (IAccumulator.NUMBER_IGNORE_AT_STARTUP_KEY
    • Dumping and resetting every configured number of samples - see IAccumulator.DUMP_EVERY_KEY

    • Field Detail

      • NAME_PROPERTY_KEY

        public static final String NAME_PROPERTY_KEY
        The property key used to specify the underlying Histogram name. This is only relevant when the underyling Histogram is dumping its internal statistics and that is only enabled when the IAccumulator.DUMP_EVERY_KEY is specified via properties.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public void accumulate(long id,
                       long val)
        Description copied from interface: IAccumulator
        Accumulates the given data point (id and value).

        This should be very fast and create no objects, so that it has minimal performance impact.

        Specified by:
        accumulate in interface IAccumulator
        Parameters:
        id - ID, if any, associated with the value. Just pass 0 or some other special value if there is no id.
        val - Value to be accumulated.

      • getAverage

        public long getAverage()
        Description copied from interface: IStats
        Return the current average value.

        This is an optional operation. Concrete implementations may choose whether or not to support based on their specific characteristics.

        Use the IStats.hasAverage() method to determine whether to expect a meaningful return from this method.

        Specified by:
        getAverage in interface IStats
        Returns:
        Average value. If the implementation does not support the concept of average value then this value is undefined.
        See Also:
        IStats.hasAverage()

      • getNegativeOutOfRangeFrequency

        public long getNegativeOutOfRangeFrequency()
        Description copied from interface: IHistogramStats
        Return the frequency of samples < the lowest interval specified.

        It is optional for implementations to support counting negative observations. When not supported this method simply returns the total number of negative observations.

        Specified by:
        getNegativeOutOfRangeFrequency in interface IHistogramStats
        Returns:
        The frequency of samples < the lowest interval specified.
        See Also:

      • getIntervalUpperBoundForConfidence

        public long getIntervalUpperBoundForConfidence(double confidence)
        Description copied from interface: IHistogramStats
        Get the interval upper bound for a given confidence of the sample population.
        Specified by:
        getIntervalUpperBoundForConfidence in interface IHistogramStats
        Parameters:
        confidence - Required confidence that number of samples is below the returned upper bound. Must be ≥ 0 and ≤ 1.
        Returns:
        The interval upper bound or 0L if there is no corresponding upper bound in the histogram.
